## Overview

Administrators can configure Python and Jupyter with Workbench for development and Connect for publishing.

For more information on end-user workflows with Python and Jupyter in Posit products, refer to the resources below.

![](configuring-python-with-rstudio.drawio.svg)

Once configured, users can publish Jupyter Notebooks or R applications that call Python scripts and code.

## Ready to integrate Jupyter Notebooks with Workbench?

You can configure Jupyter Notebooks on a single server or with external resource managers such as Kubernetes or Slurm.

* Documentation for [integrating Workbench with Jupyter Notebooks on a single server](https://docs.posit.co/rsw/integration/jupyter-standalone/)

* Documentation for [integrating Workbench with Jupyter Notebooks, Launcher, and Kubernetes](https://docs.posit.co/rsw/integration/jupyter-kubernetes/)

* Documentation for [integrating Workbench with Jupyter Notebooks, Launcher, and Slurm](https://docs.posit.co/rsw/integration/jupyter-slurm/)

## Want to help users get started developing and publishing Python with Posit products?

* Users can follow steps to [install and use Python environments and packages with Posit products](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/360023654474-Installing-and-Configuring-Python-with-RStudio)

* Administrators can install and integrate Jupyter with Workbench using the links in the above section.

* Administrators can [install Python on Workbench and Connect](https://support.posit.co/hc/en-us/articles/360021259293-Configuring-Python-with-RStudio-Server-Pro-and-RStudio-Connect)
for users to develop and publish R content that calls Python scripts and code.
